alert.note: Alert for Santa Barbara (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 24 at 11:58PM PST until February 25 at 3:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Los Angeles/Oxnard CA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in California... Santa Ynez River At Narrows affecting Santa Barbara County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding expected to begin around 4 am PST Saturday due to releases from Lake Cachuma. * WHERE...Santa Ynez River At Narrows. * WHEN...From late tonight to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flooding threatens agricultural land and outlying grounds of federal prison. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:15 PM PST Friday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.6 feet tomorrow morning around 8 am PST. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.0 feet on 03/03/1938. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 300 AM PST.
